title: Singapore's business sentiments for next 6-month turn positive: survey
content:
SINGAPORE, Jan. 29 (Xinhua) -- Singapore's Economic Development Board (EDB) and Department of Statistics (DOS) on Friday released survey reports about business expectations, showing Singaporean companies turned optimistic about the business situation for the six months starting this January.
The Business Expectations of the Manufacturing Sector survey released by the EDB showed that a weighted 36 percent of manufacturers expect business conditions to improve, while a weighted 4 percent foresee a weaker business outlook.
Overall, a net weighted balance of 32 percent of manufacturers anticipates a favorable business situation for the first half of 2021, compared to the fourth quarter of 2020.
That is an improvement from the previous edition of this survey report, which was released last October and showed a net weighted balance of 3 percent of manufacturers predicted a softer business situation for the period October 2020-March 2021, compared to the third quarter of 2020.
The Business Expectations of the Services Sector survey released by the DOS showed that a weighted 21 percent of service firms are optimistic about the business conditions in the six months starting this January, while a weighted 14 percent of such firms foresee slower business.
Overall, a net weighted balance of 7 percent of service firms anticipates more favorable business conditions for the first six months of 2021.
This is the first positive net weighted balance after four quarters of negative sentiments, the DOS report said. Enditem
